text.title: BBC Live & Breaking World and U.S. News
text.text: BBC Live & Breaking World and U.S. News Skip to content British Broadcasting Corporation Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Live News Live Sport Home News Israel-Gaza War War in Ukraine US & Canada UK UK Politics England N. Ireland N. Ireland Politics Scotland Scotland Politics Wales Wales Politics Africa Asia China India Australia Europe Latin America Middle East In Pictures BBC InDepth BBC Verify Sport Business Executive Lounge Technology of Business Future of Business Innovation Technology Science & Health Artificial Intelligence AI v the Mind Culture Film & TV Music Art & Design Style Books Entertainment News Arts Arts in Motion Travel Destinations Africa Antarctica Asia Australia and Pacific Caribbean & Bermuda Central America Europe Middle East North America South America World’s Table Culture & Experiences Adventures The SpeciaList Earth Natural Wonders Weather & Science Climate Solutions Sustainable Business Green Living Audio Podcast Categories Radio Audio FAQs Video BBC Maestro Live Live News Live Sport Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Weather Newsletters Live Now LIVE Watch UK Championship: World champion Zhao v Zhang; Ding v Donaldson Watch live coverage and follow live text updates from the UK Snooker Championship 2025 at the York Barbican. Follow Live now LIVE Premier League news conferences: Edwards to speak with Wolves 12 points from safety All the latest from Thursday's Premier League news conferences as Wolverhampton Wanderers manager Rob Edwards, Tottenham boss Thomas Frank and others speak. Follow Live now LIVE Listen live as Radio 1 counts down the biggest songs of 2025 Join Matt and Mollie as the station’s DJs pick their favourite songs of the year. Follow Live now LIVE Grooming gangs inquiry demand and state of NHS raised at FMQs John Swinney is grilled by opposition party leaders during First Minister's Questions Follow Live now LIVE Putin 'morally responsible' for 'unsurvivable' Novichok poisoning of British woman, inquiry finds An inquiry into Ms Sturgess' death in 2018 came after an attempt to poison an ex-Russian double agent living in Salisbury. Follow Live now LIVE Chinese navy task force captured by new satellite images in Philippine Sea Latest updates from the BBC's specialists in fact-checking, verifying video and tackling disinformation. Follow Live now LIVE 'My business has lost £15k so far' - Kent water crisis enters sixth day South East Water say more than 16,500 of the 24,000 properties impacted are now reconnected. Follow Live now Recently Live Relive day one of second Test as Root hits first Test century in Australia Follow live as Australia host England in the second Ashes Test in Brisbane. See how it played out More images of Epstein's private island home released by House Democrats Democrats on the House Oversight Committee released the new trove of pictures and videos from disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein's private island. See how it played out Motherwell stay third after goalless Falkirk draw Motherwell remain third in the Scottish Premiership despite being blighted by a lack of cutting edge during a scrappy goalless draw at Falkirk. See how it played out Maeda goal gives O'Neill winning Celtic send off against Dundee Celtic deliver a victorious send-off for Martin O'Neill as they move them level on points with Scottish Premiership leaders Hearts before the sides meet on Sunday. See how it played out Struggling Kilmarnock strike at death to hold leaders Hearts Hearts visit Celtic on Sunday for a top-of-the-table clash with their eight-point lead at the top of the Scottish Premiership gone, after Bruce Anderson's 90th-minute leveller for struggling Kilmarnock. See how it played out Rangers score 98th-minute penalty to snatch point at Dundee Utd Nedim Bajrami's 98th-minute penalty salvages a point for Rangers as they snatch a Scottish Premiership draw in controversial circumstances against Dundee United. See how it played out St Mirren score in 99th minute to draw six-goal thriller at Aberdeen Richard King's towering 99th-minute header earns St Mirren an unlikely Scottish Premiership point in a frantic six-goal thriller against Aberdeen. See how it played out Wales' political parties clash in live debate over having more Senedd politicians Representatives from Labour, the Tories, Plaid Cymru and Reform clashed as Wales looks ahead to the Senedd election in May. See how it played out Scottish Premiership: Watch highlights as Hearts draw allows Celtic to move level at top Watch Sportscene highlights and follow reaction from Wednesday's five Scottish Premiership matches. See how it played out Premier League: Leeds beat Chelsea, Liverpool held by Sunderland, Arsenal win Relive the action as Arsenal go five points clear at the top of the Premier League, while Liverpool are held by Sunderland. See how it played out Alexander-Arnold off injured in comfortable Real Madrid win Real Madrid coast to a 3-0 win against Athletic Club but England defender Trent Alexander-Arnold goes off injured. See how it played out BBC Radio Sheffield: Watch Wednesday's Football Heaven Watch BBC Radio Sheffield's Football Heaven discussing the latest football news. See how it played out Watch UK Championship: Trump & Selby advance to quarter-finals Watch live coverage and follow live text updates from the UK Snooker Championship 2025 at the York Barbican. See how it played out Man Utd news conference: Amorim 'needs to protect family' from social media abuse Analysis and talking points as Ruben Amorim faces the media ahead of Manchester United v West Ham. See how it played out Badenoch and Starmer clash over Budget at PMQs The chancellor continues to face accusations that she misled the public about the nation's finances ahead of last week's Budget. See how it played out Verified video shows huge explosion after failed Russian missile test Latest updates from the BBC's specialists in fact-checking, verifying video and tackling disinformation. See how it played out Rugby World Cup draw: England to face Wales as Ireland get Scotland in group stages England to meet Wales and Ireland to face Scotland in the group stages of the 2027 Rugby World Cup. See how it played out Listen: Women's Big Bash - Sydney Thunder v Brisbane Heat Listen to ABC Grandstand commentary as Sydney Thunder face Brisbane Heat in the Women's Big Bash League. See how it played out Trump only person who can break Russia-Ukraine deadlock, says Nato leader Mark Rutte's comments come a day after Putin rejected US proposals for peace in Ukraine after talks with US negotiators in Moscow. See how it played out Glentoran v Cliftonville Follow live text commentary, score updates and match stats from Glentoran vs Cliftonville in the BetMcLean Cup See how it played out Moyola Park v Coleraine Follow live score updates and match stats from Moyola Park vs Coleraine in the BetMcLean Cup See how it played out Ballymena United v Larne Follow live score updates and match stats from Ballymena United vs Larne in the BetMcLean Cup See how it played out Newry City v Linfield Follow live score updates and match stats from Newry City vs Linfield in the BetMcLean Cup See how it played out Glens, Coleraine, Linfield and Ballymena advance in BetMcLean Cup quarters - as it happened Holders beaten 5-4 in shootout with Ballymena United, Linfield and Coleraine also advancing to semi-finals. See how it played out Ipswich late show denies Blackburn in replayed game Sindre Walle Egeli's last-minute equaliser snatches an unlikely point for Ipswich at Blackburn in a replayed Championship game after the initial match was abandoned in September. See how it played out Barcelona recover to beat Atletico and go four points clear Barcelona come from behind to beat Atletico Madrid and go four points clear in La Liga. See how it played out Kendall scores as England end year with win over Ghana Lucia Kendall marked her 'homecoming' with the opening goal at St Mary's Stadium as England ended 2025 with a friendly victory over Ghana. See how it played out Premier League: Spurs draw at Newcastle, Man City edge thriller, Everton win Follow live text coverage of three Premier league games as Bournemouth host Everton, Fulham face Man City & Newcastle play Tottenham. See how it played out Howat shines in Scotland friendly win against China Kirsty Howat marks her first Scotland start with two goals, an assist and a penalty miss in a 3-2 friendly win over as captain Erin Cuthbert is released from hospital after a head knock. See how it played out BBC Radio Sheffield: Watch Tuesday's Football Heaven Watch BBC Radio Sheffield's Football Heaven discussing the latest football news. See how it played out First Minister's Questions from the Senedd: 2 December 2025 Eluned Morgan is quizzed by opposition party leaders and other MSs during First Minister's Questions. See how it played out UK Championship: Wilson out as Slessor & Hawkins advance - as it happened Relive live coverage as Ronnie O'Sullivan goes out in the first round of the UK Championship at York Barbican. See how it played out ‘Another bitter injustice’ say Hillsborough families as report finds ‘fundamental failures’ by police The report says 12 ex-police officers would have faced gross misconduct cases over the Hillsborough disaster, if they were still serving. See how it played out Kent water supply failures to stretch into sixth day South East Water says customers are back out of supply - and issues an alert for when water returns. See how it played out Wales beat Switzerland to end 12-game winless streak Wales win their first game in 13 internationals as they beat Switzerland 3-2 in a friendly in Jerez, Spain. See how it played out Whole world must seize this chance of peace, Zelensky tells Irish Parliament President Volodymyr Zelensky addresses the Irish parliament later on first official visit to the Republic of Ireland. See how it played out Fantasy Premier League gameweek 14 Q&A with expert Gianni - recap Get all your Fantasy Premier League gameweek 14 tips and team news before Saturday's deadline and send your questions to guest FPL expert Gianni Buttice. See how it played out Satellite images show reservoir levels dropping as Tehran faces water crisis Latest updates from the BBC's specialists in fact-checking, verifying video and tackling disinformation. See how it played out 'We can't trust anything South East Water say' - Tunbridge Wells set for fifth day without supply About 14,000 South East Water customers in West Kent and East Sussex are without water for a fourth consecutive day. See how it played out British Broadcasting Corporation Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Weather BBC Shop BritBox BBC in other languages The BBC is in multiple languages Read the BBC In your own language Oduu Afaan Oromootiin Amharic ዜና በአማርኛ Arabic عربي Azeri AZƏRBAYCAN Bangla বাংলা Burmese မြန်မာ Chinese 中文网 Dari دری French AFRIQUE Hausa HAUSA Hindi हिन्दी Gaelic NAIDHEACHDAN Gujarati ગુજરાતીમાં સમાચાર Igbo AKỤKỌ N’IGBO Indonesian INDONESIA Japanese 日本語 Kinyarwanda GAHUZA Kirundi KIRUNDI Korean 한국어 Kyrgyz Кыргыз Marathi मराठी Nepali नेपाली Noticias para hispanoparlantes Pashto پښتو Persian فارسی Pidgin Polish PO POLSKU Portuguese BRASIL Punjabi ਪੰਜਾਬੀ ਖ਼ਬਰਾਂ Russian НА РУССКОМ Serbian  NA SRPSKOM Sinhala සිංහල Somali SOMALI Swahili  HABARI KWA KISWAHILI Tamil தமிழில் செய்திகள் Telugu తెలుగు వార్తలు Thai ข่าวภาษาไทย Tigrinya ዜና ብትግርኛ Turkish TÜRKÇE Ukrainian УКРАЇНСЬКA Urdu اردو Uzbek O'ZBEK Vietnamese TIẾNG VIỆT Welsh NEWYDDION Yoruba  ÌRÒYÌN NÍ YORÙBÁ Follow BBC on: Terms of Use Subscription Terms About the BBC Privacy Policy Cookies Accessibility Help Contact the BBC Advertise with us Do not share or sell my info BBC.com Help & FAQs Content Index Copyright 2025 BBC.
